revised_title: Side-chain Degradation of Phenoxyalkanecarboxylic Acids by Nocardia Coeliaca and Other Microorganisms
tldr: The authors investigated the side-chain degradation of certain (o-phenoxyalkanecarboxylic acids by Nocardia coeliaca and other microorganisms isolated from soil. They found that three of the organisms, including Nocardia coeliaca, Pseudomonas sp., and Micrococcus sp., effectively degraded the side-chain of the acids. The study provides insights into the metabolism of phenoxyalkanecarboxylic acids by microorganisms in soil.
